content.body: I modified ecmaspeak-py to find violations of the if-command-branches-must-do-the-same-thing convention, found 8.
Actually, on second thought, they're not of the single-line form.

They're all of the form
  If cond, something.
  Else, something.

Okay, got it right this time, I think. Found 1 violation, in https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-object-environment-records-getbindingvalue-n-s: "If _S_ is *false*, return *undefined*; otherwise throw a *ReferenceError* exception."
content.formatted_body: Okay, got it right this time, I think. Found 1 violation, in https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-object-environment-records-getbindingvalue-n-s: "If S is false, return undefined; otherwise throw a ReferenceError exception."

content.body: But 'throw' is just a shorthand for 'return', so you could say they do the same thing.
hmm, yeah that one seems close enough
Though also could easily be "1. If S is true, throw a RE exception. 1. Return undefined."
